Would you like to be part of a cross-functional team focused on assessing the comparative costs and Return on Investment (ROI) of migrating and running applications on AWS by engaging directly with C-level executives
column2: IT professionals and influencers at all levels? Can you take complex IT infrastructure and virtualization scenarios and simplify them down to the essentials
column3: crafting models and financial assessments that are easy to understand and apply? Are you good at defining and quantifying business value
column4: benefits and migration costs of improved processes and tooling? Do you have the business background
column7: analytical skills and communication skills needed to help further establish Amazon as the leader in cloud computing?

column1: As a Cloud Economics Business Development Representative within AWS
column2: you will help AWS customers and prospective customers shape their information technology strategies and IT financial models
column3: and quantify the benefits of running applications in the cloud. To do this
column4: you will work with AWS partners and other groups within AWS to give AWS customers the best insights into how to run their applications on AWS
column5: in the most cost effective manner. You will identify economic barriers to adoption of AWS with these customers and develop repeatable strategies to overcome these barriers. You will communicate the economic value proposition for AWS to a broad audience of IT leaders. You will engage with AWS partners
column7: to address concerns regarding software license management. You will also be expected to be the focal point within AWS for all TCO
column8: ROI and cost efficiency business development activities.

column1: Your responsibilities will include driving ROI/economic related BD activities within AWS
column4: BD and products teams on ROI/economic related customer engagements. You will serve as an expert resource on the financial modeling of IT applications and infrastructures. In appropriate cases you will bring in other AWS resources as necessary to help our customers properly evaluate their IT options from an economic perspective.

column1: The ideal candidate will possess a business and IT background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the highest levels of startups and also large enterprises. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the economic benefits of cloud computing to IT architects
column2: engineering teams and C-Level executives. The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term about the needs of complex global businesses. The ideal candidate will also be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments
column3: with data center economics including data center migration and refresh cycles
column5: and be capable of creating detailed cost models for these environments. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated abilities to influence decision makers in a consultative selling approach (preferably through previous sales or presales experience) to progress decision making through their personal involvement with developing and presenting a compelling business case.

column1: Serve as a key member of the Business Development team in helping to drive AWS Marketing and Sales engagements with our customers regarding the economics of their IT infrastructure.

column3: drive proactive of ROI/economic conversations with our customers.

column1: Develop a standard ROI framework and dynamic analytic model to be utilized by the AWS Sales
Serve as a central resource for the Sales team to help our customers create appropriately detailed financial models for their current and future IT landscape.
Create a repository of Cloud Economic cases studies and conversations to share learnings with all parts of AWS.
Serve as a key source of market insights into how our customers view the economic benefit of using AWS relative to deploying applications on-premise or in traditional data centers.

Work with internal stakeholders to communicate market realities regarding the economics of running IT applications and infrastructures in the cloud when compared to a traditional data center environment.
Prepare and present business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks on TCO related issues
Experience creating and presenting business cases to non-technical decision makers
Experience with pro forma income statement and balance sheet modeling
column2: and experience with KPIs such as EBITDA

column3: and experience in building migration business cases highly desired.

column1: MBA or equivalent relevant business experience
The right person will have strong business sense and be technical and analytical.
An understanding the complexities of IT environments.
Experience with data center migration and IT refresh analysis
Strong verbal and written communications skills are a must
ust have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations

column1: Save SOC - Event Monitoring Tier 3 Analyst at Deloitte España
The Deloitte Global Cybersecurity function is responsible for the firm’s overall objectives of enhancing data protection
column2: standardizing and securing critical infrastructure and gaining cyber visibility through security operations centers. The Cybersecurity organization delivers a comprehensive set of cybersecurity services to Deloitte member firms through regional delivery hubs and a Global Fusion Center. We are seeking an EMEA L3 Analyst to join the team.

column1: The EMEA L3 Analyst reports to the EMEA EM Service Delivery Manager. The role focusses on providing Event Monitoring services for the EMEA Security Operations Center (SOC) and serves as an advanced escalation point addressing potential information security incidents. The EMEA Level 3 Analyst also serves as a mentor for multiple Event Monitoring technologies.
As part of the Global Cybersecurity team

column2: trends and implications concerning the design and integration of evolving systems and solutions

column4: and support the remediation of critical information security incidents Handle incident escalations as necessary from other analysts

column5: and escalation follow up activity status

column1: Responsible for identifying training needs for the junior analysts
Remain current on cyber security trends and intelligence (open source and commercial) to guide the security analysis & identification capabilities of the team
Ensures that all identified events are promptly validated and thoroughly investigated
Oversee documentation owned by the SOC team including but not limited to Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Operational Level Agreements (OLAs)
You will have a training plan

column2: IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness the power of healthcare data
column5: and advanced analytics to drive healthcare forward. The Commercial Operations Analyst will be responsible for supporting the Spanish business in all areas of opportunity management and operations. They will provide support to the commercial and finance teams in ensuring opportunities are setup and processed correctly in order that revenue recognition and billing happen on time and according to company guidelines. Principal Accountabilities: Provides financial reporting to Finance and Commercial teams. Develops a strong understanding of internal and external revenue recognition rules to ensure revenue against customer contracts follows US GAAP and internal guidelines. Understands IQVIA billing process gives advice in complex matters. Acts as a link between Sales Admin/Commercial team and Billing team. Builds strong relationships with the sales
column6: offering and finance teams to ensure queries are efficiently addressed meaning no delay to business operations. Analyses structured financial and operational reports to identify trends

column2: working hard to save time and money for all companies running digital advertisements with our cool product.

column2: which makes our story a compelling one. Recently we closed big deals like Repsol and Cetelem.

column1: What’s so cool about all this? We don’t do long approval processes. We just deliver. You will be joining a company with highly skilled
column2: smart people that are all overachievers and want to be “the best”

column3: and requirements for the Data team.

column2: building new products and evolving existing models.

column1: +5 years of professional experience in a data scientist or analyst role; experience applied to business problems is a plus.
MSc (or PhD) in a numerical field such as Mathematics

An analytical mindset: ability to deep dive into our datasets and generate insightful analyses that enable us to improve different elements of product and business operations.

column2: developing and testing predictive algorithms by using state-of-the-art machine learning solutions
column3: and statistical models. Familiar with time series analysis is a plus.

What other skills do we value?
You enjoy reading academic papers and implementing experimental systems.
You have experience presenting at industry recognized ML conferences as well as being published in the field.
Hands-on analytical experience on large volumes of data (Spark
Experience with Google Cloud Platform data products (BigQuery
Previous experience with Docker and Docker ecosystem (Kubernetes).
Why You Might NOT Enjoy This Position
You prefer to be managed; you act when asked and let others come up with ideas.
Fast-paced environments make your head spin.
A flexible and fun working environment of startups in the very center of Madrid.
An opportunity to make a team grow from the start.
An office where everyone breathes SaaS and looks for scalable solutions.

What are we looking for? As Senior Auditor / Data Analyst you will be part of the international Data Analytics team based in both Amsterdam and Madrid in Corporate Audit Services (CAS)/ CAS is a highly professional organization with approximately 20 audit teams located across the globe forming a diverse international team of around 400 members/ CAS conducts and coordinates audits across all business and risk areas and countries/ The Data analyst will join a dedicated Data Analytics team
column14: which supports multiple audit teams (worldwide) in their efforts to analyze business data efficiently and help identify control issues/ Furthermore
column15: you will support the development of more advanced analytics-driven audits

column1: Save Internship Data Analytics at Easy Virtual Fair

You have 0 connections at this company.
DescripciónDetalle de Producto - Easy Virtual Fair

Actualmente estamos buscando estudiantes de último o penúltimo año con ganas de unirse a nuestro equipo de Digital & Analytics Strategy en EY-Parthenon. Con nosotros podrás desarrollar tu pasión por los Data Analytics y ayudar a definir la estrategia de negocio de nuestros clientes.
Tratamiento y pre-procesado de bases de datos estructuradas y no-estructuradas.
Desarrollar modelos estadísticos y de aprendizaje automático.
Desarrollar aplicaciones empresariales de vanguardia basadas en análisis estadísticos y técnicas de modelado predictivo / prescriptivo.
Apoyar en los procesos de transformación digital hacia una cultura centrada en los datos (data-driven).
Generar visualizaciones y presentaciones de datos de alto impacto.
Conocimiento de bases de datos relacionales (SQL).
Conocimiento de lenguaje de programación Python y/o R.
Deseable conocimiento de aplicaciones de visualización (e.g. Tableau).

The mission of the RISK function
Advise the Bank Management on the definition of risk policy.
Contribute as a ""second pair of eyes"" to ensure that risks taken by the Bank are aligned with its policies.
Report and alert Bank Management on the status of risks to which the Bank is exposed.

Serve as a key source of market insights into how our customers view the economic benefit of using AWS relative to deploying applications on-premise or in traditional data centers.

Work with internal stakeholders to communicate market realities regarding the economics of running IT applications and infrastructures in the cloud when compared to a traditional data center environment.
Prepare and present business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks on TCO related issues

Experience with pro forma income statement and balance sheet modeling

You have 0 connections at this company.

The project Cloud Migration Services (CMS) will be responsible for migrating legacy analytic & business intelligence solutions and their associated data pipelines across Vodafone onto the Google Cloud Platform. CMS will be an integral part of Nucleus a multi-year programme to roll out a new Business Intelligence Solution based on Google Cloud Platform for all local markets replacing the existing BI solution.

The Data Engineer delivers data pipelines and data service components. This will be at industrial scale delivering 20+ countries local data to a central “Data Ocean” hosted in the cloud. The data engineer will need to design highly efficient pipelines for performance and reliability. Our goal is to create a self-healing solution that reduced operational support by over 70%.
Key Focus For a Data Engineer Will Be

column2: Test Engineer and Product Owner in an Agile Squad to create data pipelines for each local market migration.

Build data pipelines that make use of large volumes of data and generate outputs that allow commercial and business actions that generate incremental value.
Create semantic layers for Business Intelligence users and feature engineering for data science.

IT Partner España busca para incorporación a su plantilla los siguientes perfiles profesionales: Arquitecto/a Big Data.

– Aportación de ideas y soluciones arquitectónicas. – Implementación de escenarios de pruebas de amplio espectro para testear las diferentes plataformas integradas.

– Conocimientos a nivel de arquitectura de Data Processing (RT

– Modelado de datos y diseños arquitectónicos.

column1: Save Data Scientist & Analytics Crm at Ogilvy
See how you compare to 13 applicants. Reactivate Premium
You have 0 connections at this company.

Resumen En la agencia GTB Madrid estamos buscando un perfil de Data Scientist & Analytics CRM. Responsibilidades Análisis cuantitativos que produzcan insights accionables de CRM para agilizar la captación de leads y retención de clientes. Monitorización y análisis de información y métricas de negocio para proponer acciones realizables que ayuden a alcanzar objetivos establecidos. Definición de perfiles de clientes y estudio de patrones de comportamiento como apoyo para proyectos futuros. Extracción de información de la base de datos y creación de modelos de propensión. Implementación de un método de visualización de datos para la destilación de datos. Cualificación Grado y/o Máster en Matemáticas
column5: Economía. Al menos 1 año trabajando con analítica de datos y desarrollo de modelos predictivos. Formación complementaria en temas como Machine Learning
column8: Big Data o Data Mining. Conocimiento en diseño e implementación de modelos de propensión y segmentación. Conocimiento de lenguajes de programación y tratamiento de bases de datos como SQL y/o Python. Conocimiento en PowerBI
column9: Tableau y/o Customer journey. Nivel intermedio/alto de inglés. Experiencia en Data Analysis en Marketing / Ventas
column10: Sector Automoción y Agencia de Comunicación.

Implementación de un método de visualización de datos para la destilación de datos. Cualificación Grado y/o Máster en Matemáticas
column5: Economía. Al menos 1 año trabajando con analítica de datos y desarrollo de modelos predictivos. Formación complementaria en temas como Machine Learning
column8: Big Data o Data Mining. Conocimiento en diseño e implementación de modelos de propensión y segmentación. Conocimiento de lenguajes de programación y tratamiento de bases de datos como SQL y/o Python. Conocimiento en PowerBI
column9: Tableau y/o Customer journey. Nivel intermedio/alto de inglés. Experiencia en Data Analysis en Marketing / Ventas
column10: Sector Automoción y Agencia de Comunicación.

DescripciónIntegrándose en el Departamento de Data Office buscamos a una persona que se incorpore al equipo como Data Scientist. Participará en el desarrollo de modelos analíticos para resolver problemas de negocio
column2: facilitando la extracción de. conclusiones sobre los datos.

column1: Análisis de conjuntos de datos con técnicas de Machine Learning
column2: con el objetivo de identificar patrones y predecir comportamientos futuros.

column1: Aplicar algoritmos de Deep Learning para realizar analítica avanzada.
Preparación y análisis de datos estructurados y no estructurados.
Monitorizar el rendimiento y la efectividad de los modelos implementados.
Aportar análisis que faciliten la toma de decisiones a las distintas Áreas de Negocio de la Compañía. ¿Qué buscamos? Buscamos:
Se valorará máster en Big Data o símiles.
Nivel alto de inglés C1 (se hará prueba de nivel)
Experiencia previa en Gestión de Proyectos de Analítica Avanzada y Text Analytics.
Conocimiento en lenguaje de programación R y Phyton.
Experiencia en la elaboración de Modelos de Machine Learning: Modelos supervisados y no supervisados. Conocimiento de ensamblaje de modelos: Random Forest
Experiencia en la preparación y generación de algoritmos de Redes Neuronales.
Conocimiento de entornos de análisis como Microsoft Azure
column3: así como Jupyter Notebook. Se requieren en torno a 3

column1: 4 años de experiencia realizando funciones similares. Buscamos a alguien capaz de gestionar

column1: Who are we? We’re OrbitalAds – a diverse team of passionate problem-solvers focused on keyword management
column2: which translates into time and money savings for all companies running digital advertisements with our cool product.

column1: We are proud to be named one of the Google Premier Partners as well as flaunt a nice 300% growth YoY.
Our customers <3 our product! We hardly have any churn
column2: which makes our story a compelling one. Recently we closed big deals like Repsol and Cetelem.

column1: What’s so cool about all this? You are joining a Series A phase growth company – which means you’ll reap the glory of bringing us to the next stage and change the way the business world communicates. There is no complex hierarchy. We don’t do long approval processes. We just deliver. You will be joining a company with highly skilled
column2: smart people that are all overachievers and want to be “the best”

column1: Experience working on a dynamic and interdisciplinary environment: you will work closely with Engineering
Identify new business opportunities and answer critical business questions about Digital Marketing through deep data analysis in order to make our product more intelligent.
Experiment with machine learning approaches to solve complex business problems no one has ever attempted before.
Explore NLP state of the art with various datasets
column2: building new products and evolving existing models.

column1: +2 years of professional experience in a data scientist or analyst role; experience applied to NLP

column1: A proactive and analytical mindset: the ability to deep dive into our datasets and generate insightful analyses that enable us to improve different elements of product and business operations.

Strong coding skills in Python with data analysis and visualizing and machine learning libraries (numpy
What other skills do we value?

column3: cuando próximamente tengamos un nuevo puesto de Big Data

column1: Nivel de Puesto : Técnico Senior. Dependencia : Director General / Chief Data Officer / CIO. Sin equipo a su cargo. Misión : Proporcionar sentido y significado a los datos que se recogen en los proyectos de integración de Big Data de la empresa
column2: analizando los resultados de las estrategias de negocio y siendo parte fundamental en el proceso de recopilación de grandes cantidades de datos en diferentes formatos
column3: transformando datos en información relevante y útil para la toma de decisiones. Funciones : + Diseñar e implementar modelos que permitan recopilar
column6: limpiar y analizar un gran volumen de datos en varios formatos
column14: y traducirlos en información útil y relevante para la empresa. + Dar sentido y significado a los datos que se recogen de los proyectos de integración de Big Data de una compañía. + Analizar los resultados de las estrategias de inteligencia de negocio
column15: siendo parte fundamental en el proceso de recopilación de grandes cantidades de datos en diferentes formatos. + Representar visualmente el resultado producto del análisis de todos esos datos
column16: así como también de desarrollar planes de análisis de datos en plataformas como redes sociales
column19: etc. + Llevar a cabo investigaciones y hacer recomendaciones sobre productos

The mission of the RISK function
Advise the Bank Management on the definition of risk policy.
Contribute as a ""second pair of eyes"" to ensure that risks taken by the Bank are aligned with its policies.
Report and alert Bank Management on the status of risks to which the Bank is exposed.

RISK Artificial Intelligence Research is an AI expert team in charge of developing Artificial Intelligence solutions for RISK Streams and beyond. This involves in particular understanding about what data is available and what the pain point to be addressed is.
As a data scientist within RISK AIR
column2: you will work on a variety of AI and data science topics applied to real data (financial and much more). Because the RISK function is transverse within the bank
column3: we face a variety of data (structured and unstructured) and tasks (prediction
column10: anomaly detection and knowledge graphs). Your role is to leverage the data or knowledge and develop algorithms to address the customer pain point. You will work together with one or two other data scientists on each project and with our software engineers. Beyond projects
column11: you will be expected to share your expertise at multiple levels: within the team though technical sharing sessions and beyond as well during our regular open discussion sessions on AI. Finally
column12: as we publish some of our work within academic journals and conferences (e.g.
column18: you will participate to the associated research and writing effort.

What are we looking for? As Senior Auditor / Data Analyst you will be part of the international Data Analytics team based in both Amsterdam and Madrid in Corporate Audit Services (CAS)/ CAS is a highly professional organization with approximately 20 audit teams located across the globe forming a diverse international team of around 400 members/ CAS conducts and coordinates audits across all business and risk areas and countries/ The Data analyst will join a dedicated Data Analytics team
column14: which supports multiple audit teams (worldwide) in their efforts to analyze business data efficiently and help identify control issues/ Furthermore

column1: The mission of the RISK function
To advise the Bank on risk appetite definition
To contribute as an objective ""second pair of eyes"" that risks taken on by the Bank align with its policies
To report and alert Bank Management of the status of risks to which the Bank is exposed
To contribute to the development and growth of the risk culture within the Group

column2: RISK Artificial Intelligence Research is an AI expert team in charge of developing Artificial Intelligence solutions for RISK Streams and beyond. This involves in particular assisting internal customer with the definition of their project
column3: understanding what data is available and what the pain point to be addressed is. Then the team proceeds to develop algorithms to address the identified pain point based on the data provided. Finally
column4: we develop systems /applications (interface + back end) to give access to the solution built to designated internal users. In addition to the development of use cases
column5: they also provide technical expertise on artificial intelligence topic (for instance review of internal or external solutions) and seek to develop some API based on common data processing needs.

column1: As a software engineer within RISK AIR
column2: you will be in charge of the application development and deployment in collaboration with the data scientist and our UX designer. Software engineers are involved within our projects from start to finish
column3: providing early on guidance on the feasibility of the solutions dreamed by our clients
column4: ensuring proper code structuring and management by our data scientist
column5: managing the devops set up of the project and actively participating in the industrialization discussion with the target IT.

column3: people who are as comfortable with front-end development as with storage and back end

column1: Fluent in written and spoken English.

Solid track record in writing quality scientific publications and representing BMS at international congresses
Knowledge of Disease Area and local health care system/market dynamics
Understanding of environmental and industry trends and their impact on the business
Understanding of product-specific pricing issues and required contribution to pricing and reimbursement dossiers

Testing automation engineers install and set up databases and backup applications to prevent errors and protect against data loss.
Testing automation engineers analyze systems to identify potential quality issues that could affect apps.
Testing automation engineers collaborate with other members of the engineering team to find the best methods for solving problems in apps and systems.

column1: Zooplusis building an in-house big data platform that will allow us to scale our data strategy for the future. In this role you will have the opportunity to be working in the development of a cutting-edge data platform that will be core for the company. You will integrate into an experienced agile team (using Scrum plus other agile frameworks) that is building our data platform from the ground up on the AWS cloud. You will also develop the integration of different data sources covering the whole ecosystem of Big Data technologies.

This is an almost greenfield project where the team holds full ownership
column2: from idea to production: you build it you run it.

column3: with great infrastructure links. Additionally we offer competitive benefits such as:

column1: The Role: Game Analytics Software Engineer

The Game Analytics Software Engineer is a new exciting role where you will help create efficiencies in our sports games by using knowledge of software architecture and behavior to implement and improve game code health monitoring that will be consumed by our automated tools and automated reporting systems.
You will use your knowledge to identify game events in code and insert telemetry to measure

You will provide unit-testing implementation and support for critical game features. You will update and instrument new advanced AI systems with health reporting mechanisms and telemetry (for supported games).
As an embedded member of a game’s dev team you will work closely with them and other external GASE engineers to share best practices and common quality process improvement recommendations.
Work closely with game team developers to implement new C++ game code and refactor legacy code with instrumentation to measure feature behavior and game health.
Work with game quality assurance analysts to understand testing processes and how to assist them programmatically from game code directly.

About us Busuu is the app that makes learning a language easier for everyone and proves that learning a language doesn-t have to be done in a classroom. We are the world's largest language learning community with over 100 million users 190 countries
column3: 000 new users per day. We make learning a language easy by combining AI-powered courses with instant feedback from our global community of native speakers and live tutoring from qualified teachers across the world. If you are passionate about languages

As a Software Development Engineer we have great things to come into your area of responsibilities You will work with other Engineering Members in building scalable services
column12: which will operate across different Data Centers. You will participate in architecture discussion and shape how Busuu will work for the next 10 years. The main focus will be in our B2B product area

What we-re looking for in a Software Development Engineer: Excellent knowledge in PHP7 and/or nodeJS and building scalable services. Experience in data modelling and performance optimisation using relational databases (we use MySQL and PostgreSQL). Solid knowledge of API design

column1: What Are The Details Of This Position

As an Embedded Research And Development Engineer your key areas of responsibility will be reverse engineer vehicles and various automotive accessories to create documentation and algorithms. Implement new logic into our device firmware
column2: programming primarily in C. You will need to work closely with the Hardware Team to design and test the next generation of embedded devices. To be successful in this role you will have a keen eye for details to consistently adhere to coding standards and perform peer QA and code reviews. Being inquisitive and constantly looking for a new technical challenge or to use a new tool will also contribute to your success. In addition
column3: the successful candidate will have strong communication skills
column6: and with providing technical support to other Geotab teams. The ideal candidate should be highly technical with an interest in hacking computers
column7: reverse engineering and exploring digital systems. Automotive background is not strictly required
column8: but a strong computer networking and some electronics hardware experience background will be an asset.

column1: Perform firmware development using C as per the development standards
Perform quality assurance by doing peer review
column2: ensuring coding standards are followed and looking for logic errors and other bugs

column1: Keep up-to-date documentation for all your areas of responsibility
Determine and document various vehicles' electrical architecture and design
Connect and capture data from vehicles' internal serial networks
Create and/or modify any custom software tooling required to support the reverse engineering process
Design new features based on internal and external requests
Collaborate in the specification and design of new hardware products
Create new firmware for new hardware devices
Implement new protocols in the communication server (C++)
3+ years experience in embedded development using C
Linux advanced usage and programming knowledge
Experience with automotive networking technology (CANbus) an asset
Familiarity with engine protocols and OEMs an asset
Experience with encryption or cryptographic modules an asset

The mission of the RISK function
Advise the Bank Management on the definition of risk policy.
Contribute as a ""second pair of eyes"" to ensure that risks taken by the Bank are aligned with its policies.
Report and alert Bank Management on the status of risks to which the Bank is exposed.

RISK Artificial Intelligence Research is an AI expert team in charge of developing Artificial Intelligence solutions for RISK Streams and beyond. This involves in particular understanding about what data is available and what the pain point to be addressed is.
As a data scientist within RISK AIR
column2: you will work on a variety of AI and data science topics applied to real data (financial and much more). Because the RISK function is transverse within the bank
column3: we face a variety of data (structured and unstructured) and tasks (prediction
column10: anomaly detection and knowledge graphs). Your role is to leverage the data or knowledge and develop algorithms to address the customer pain point. You will work together with one or two other data scientists on each project and with our software engineers. Beyond projects
column11: you will be expected to share your expertise at multiple levels: within the team though technical sharing sessions and beyond as well during our regular open discussion sessions on AI. Finally
column12: as we publish some of our work within academic journals and conferences (e.g.
column18: you will participate to the associated research and writing effort.

For Airbus Defence and Space (Airbus DS) in Spain within the Information Management Security team we are looking for a DevSecOps Engineer to improve the DevSecOps workflow.
You are a highly motivated DevSecOps Engineer that enjoys solving problems and simplify solutions with real working experience on automation in Cloud providers like AWS
column3: strong secure development background and real passion for Security.

column1: Airbus is a regulated environment and we push the limits to ensure our data is secure and our products are on time and on quality while fulfilling our security commitments with customers and regulators.
Reporting to the Head of IM Security Spain you will have a high involvement in international initiatives at Airbus level.
As a DevSecOps Engineer you will drive the Airbus DS evolution to Cloud and improve the security of our developments
column5: architectures applications and processes and auditing applications source code.

column1: You will be joining challenging and complex projects
column2: with tight timeframes to ensure that the Airbus systems are automated and properly protected by joining projects to define and engineer the systems Airbus is creating.

column1: This job will also imply ensuring the security of our applications by auditing code
column2: define the proper security checks in the CI/CD chain and being able to create or validate the security documents and best practices.

column1: The position requires excellent Information security skills
column2: a deep understanding and proven experience in Cloud Security technologies and development skills beside a solid education in Cyber Security and Information Technology.

column1: Leading the Cloud Security and Secure developments activities within the team.
Act as a Security responsible for Cloud
Define the best practices in DevSecOps & Automation for Airbus DS.
Maintain & improve the best practices in secure software development for Airbus DS.

column2: looking for vulnerabilities and proposing actions to improve the security and quality of the code.

column1: Provide expertise in the DevSecOps workflow & work in a global solution for Airbus DS.
Leading projects and ensuring the quality of the deliverables.
Develop proposals to manage and reduce risks.
Provide reports for IM and IM Cyber Security Management on a regularly basis.
Responsible of the implementation of Information cybersecurity strategy according to Airbus policies.
Participate in the Airbus international workgroups.
Support other activities in the IM Security department.

column2: willingness to understand how things work
column3: how to break and fix them.

column1: Highly innovative mindset and permanently challenging the status quo.
Willingness to do always your best
At least 5 years in Information Security.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Ability to work in an environment that requires a high level of detail and confidentiality.

column2: self-motivated with the ability to work independently and as a team member in a challenging environment.

column1: Able to work autonomously as well as in international teams.
Knowledge of network and application security architecture and operating systems.
Systems and applications architecture design experience.
Project and Service management skills and experience.
Working experience on building DevSecOps workflows & CI/CD toolchains.
Knowledge of how to secure Infrastructure as a Code and API/REST.
Experience in source code security analysis.
Being able to automate security and audit applications (Static & Dynamic) to provide security improvements.
Knowledge on how to build cloud ready applications through containerization
Experience in Compliance checking with SCAP.
Experience in continuous integration pipeline with Jenkins
Experience with programming languages in real projects: Python
Must be able to link security risk to provide business value.
